review.title: Exploiting Uncertain and Temporal Information in Correlation
review.abstract:
A modelling language is described which is suitable for the correlation of information when the underlying functional model of the system is incomplete or uncertain and the temporal dependencies are imprecise. An efficient and incremental implementation is outlined which depends on cost functions satisfying certain criteria. Possibilistic logic and probability theory (as it is used in the applications targetted) satisfy these criteria.




The models are described using an independent approach:
1. The system generates its function (if there is a parameter) and then calculates a parameter in a subset of the parameters. The model then creates a model for each parameter, in the case of an underlying computation.
2. The models are tested for the following tasks:
2. The algorithm is tested for a certain kind of functional model that is not the best fit for the model.
3. The model is run to generate a set of parameters.
4. The model generates its function (if there is a parameter) and then calculates a parameter in the same way as that of any other computational model.
5. The model generates its function (if there is a parameter) and then generates a parameter in the same way as that of any other computational model. The model then produces a model for each parameter and then generates a parameter in the same way as that of any other computational model. The model then produces a model for each parameter and then generates a parameter in the same way as that of any other computational model.
6. The model generates its function (if there is a parameter) and then calculates a parameter in the same way as that of any other computational model. The model then generates a model for each parameter and then generates a parameter in the same way as that of any other computational model.
7. The model generates its function (if there is a parameter) and then generates a parameter in the same way as that of any other computational model. The model then generates a model for each parameter and then generates a parameter in the same way as that of any other computational model. The model then generates a model for each parameter and then generates a parameter in the same way as that of any other computational model. The model then generates a model for each parameter and then generates a parameter in the same way as that of any other computational model.
